snippet: The sentence is being widely seen as political persecution of the Nobel laureate Liu Xiaobo, who is himself serving an 11-year prison sentence.
abstract: Chinese court sentences Liu Hui, brother-in-law of persecuted Nobel Peace Prize winner Liu Xiaobo, to 11 years in prison on charges of financial fraud; sentence is extraordinary for its severity and is widely viewed as instance of political persecution.
lead_paragraph: The sentence is being widely seen as political persecution of the Nobel laureate Liu Xiaobo, who is himself serving an 11-year prison sentence.

headline.seo: China Sentences Brother-in-Law of Nobel Laureate to Prison
headline.main: China Sentences Brother-in-Law of Nobel Laureate to 11 Years on Fraud Charges
headline.print_headline: China Sentences Brother-in-Law of Nobel Laureate to 11 Years on Fraud Charges

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
